headline: WWE'13  review
text: Reading this on mobile? Click here to view American wrestling inhabits its own parallel universe of aggressive bodybuilder soap opera. WWE games are just as inscrutable to outsiders, involving trundling your stiff-limbed muscle-dummy around the ring and its immediate locale, grappling, pounding and stomping on your opponent's solar plexus until they submit. WWE '13 recreates the "attitude era", which means heels and babyfaces such as The Undertaker, The Rock and Hulk Hogan. If that's an exciting prospect this may well be for you, but this is a game unlikely to win over new fans.
